name: py-plotly

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description: An interactive, browser-based graphing library for Python

dependencies.name: py-decorator
dependencies.description:
The aim of the decorator module it to simplify the usage of decorators
for the average programmer, and to popularize decorators by showing
various non-trivial examples.

dependencies.name: py-jupyterlab
dependencies.description:
JupyterLab is the next-generation web-based user interface for Project
Jupyter.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-pytz
dependencies.description: World timezone definitions, modern and historical.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: python-venv
dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment

dependent_to.name: py-parsl
dependent_to.description: Simple data dependent workflows in Python

dependent_to.name: py-kb-python
dependent_to.description: Python wrapper around kallisto | bustools for scRNA-seq analysis.

dependent_to.name: py-cufflinks
dependent_to.description:
Productivity Tools for Plotly + Pandas. This library binds the power of
plotly with the flexibility of pandas for easy plotting.

dependent_to.name: py-pymatgen
dependent_to.description:
Python Materials Genomics is a robust materials analysis code that
defines core object representations for structures and molecules with
support for many electronic structure codes. It is currently the core
analysis code powering the Materials Project.

dependent_to.name: py-nanoplot
dependent_to.description: Plotting scripts for long read sequencing data

dependent_to.name: py-geomdl
dependent_to.description: Object-oriented pure Python B-Spline and NURBS library.

dependent_to.name: py-multiqc
dependent_to.description:
MultiQC is a tool to aggregate bioinformatics results across many
samples into a single report. It is written in Python and contains
modules for a large number of common bioinformatics tools.

dependent_to.name: py-openai
dependent_to.description:
The OpenAI Python library provides convenient access to the OpenAI API
from applications written in the Python language. It includes a pre-
defined set of classes for API resources that initialize themselves
dynamically from API responses which makes it compatible with a wide
range of versions of the OpenAI API.

dependent_to.name: py-pyomo
dependent_to.description:
Pyomo is a Python-based open-source software package that supports a
diverse set of optimization capabilities for formulating and analyzing
optimization models.

dependent_to.name: py-deeptools
dependent_to.description:
deepTools addresses the challenge of handling the large amounts of data
that are now routinely generated from DNA sequencing centers.

dependent_to.name: py-abipy
dependent_to.description: Python package to automate ABINIT calculations and analyze the results.

dependent_to.name: py-ax-platform
dependent_to.description:
Adaptive experimentation is the machine-learning guided process of
iteratively exploring a (possibly infinite) parameter space in order to
identify optimal configurations in a resource-efficient manner. Ax
currently supports Bayesian optimization and bandit optimization as
exploration strategies. Bayesian optimization in Ax is powered by
BoTorch, a modern library for Bayesian optimization research built on
PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-chart-studio
dependent_to.description: Utilities for interfacing with plotly's Chart Studio.
